title.text: Cohesion and Collocation: Using Context Vectors in Text Segmentation

abstractContent.text: Collocational word similarity is considered a source of text cohesion that is hard to measure and quantify.
The work presented here explores the use of information from a training corpus in measuring word similarity and evaluates the method in the text seg-mentation task.
An implementation, the VecTile system, produces similarity curves over texts using pre-compiled vector representations of the contex-tual behavior of words.
The performance of this system is shown to improve over that of the purely string-based TextTiling algorithm (Hearst, 1997).
